Adult/immature.description: Eurasian-collared Dove has a square-tipped tail and a black crescent on the back of the neck rather than the Mourning Dove's tapered tail and black cheek smudge. They also lack the Mourning Dove's dark wing spots.

Adult.description: White-winged Doves have short, square-tipped tails rather than Mourning Dove's long, tapered tail. The White-winged's wing patch is visible even at rest.
Rock Pigeons are larger than Mourning Doves and have shorter tails with overall gray rather than brown plumage.
Band-tailed Pigeons are larger than Mourning Doves with square-tipped tails and overall dark grayish, rather than pale brown, plumage.

Adult (White tipped).description: White-tipped Doves are darker gray above than Mourning Doves and have square-tipped tails.

Adult/immature.description: Common Ground-Doves are smaller than adult Mourning Doves and have short, square-tipped tails. Compared with juvenile Mourning Doves, they have less scaling and a bright red or pink base to the bill.

Inca Doves are smaller than adult Mourning Doves and are extensively scaled, with chestnut wing patches that are visible in flight. The square-tipped tail helps set it apart from juvenile Mourning Doves.
